results.title: Jamieson Primary School
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: The town of Jamieson, in north-eastern Victoria, is fiercely proud and protective of its historical primary school. With a school population hanging on for dear life, they understand only too well how much a primary school is the beating heart of a small community. It is also a place where life-long friendships are forged, and the school community (past and present) come together here to reflect on the ties that bind them to Jamieson. Principal Genevieve Bolwell also discusses the exciting school programs, which will take the next generation into the future.

results.title: The Sexes: what's the difference?
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook, Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Examines the question of whether or not there are certain basic biological differences between males and females. The assertion that the socialisation of children totally determines their social behaviour and attitudes is disputed. Environmental factors may not be the sole determinants of sex roles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Four centuries of growing pains
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
The film traces the origins of the British Commonwealth through four hundred years of history. It reviews how countries like Canada, Australia, India, and other continental and island territories, came to be added, and how each developed to the point of self-government.

results.title: The Differences are inherited
results.creator_credit: Diederik d'Ailly and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
A highly visual exposition of heredity. Features an outstanding production combination in which the already rapid growth cycle of the fruit fly is speeded up through time lapse photography to show the actual development of living beings, both normal and abnormal.

results.title: Can it hold together?
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
To examine this question, the film brings into focus recent historic events as recorded by the motion picture camera. We see the Commonwealth members in the arena of world affairs frequently taking diverging views on international issues but able, through their very differences, to serve as channels of communication between countries outside the Commonwealth. Edgar McInnis analyses some paradoxical situations that have arisen during the course of the Cold War, in which differing views and opposing loyalties inside the Commonwealth have helped to offset an East-West split. Narrated by Edgar McInnis.

results.title: The Jerusalem passion
results.brief_description: Recorded live in the Concert Hall of the Queensland Performing Arts Complex on 9th April 1988. “The Jerusalem passion” was composed and conducted by Christian music director, Murray Wylie and features the Vision One Choir and Orchestra, supported by vocalists Sue Elliott, Jeff Baldock, David Hall, Helen Maguire, Jim McCrystal, Damien Roche, Julie Vidler and Kate Wylie. Playing the pipe organ is Eduarda Van Klinken and the oratorio is narrated by Helen Foster. Vision One is an Australia-wide Christian music initiative.

results.title: A Pain in the back
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
A documentary about the causes of back pain in humans and the ways that different people cope with it. The methods, used for the treatment of back pain, that are looked at in the program are exercise, acupuncture and surgical intervention.
